questions.question: If I hadn’t failed my exam, I …………………… a better job.
questions.description: In the third conditional we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would/could/might have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: I knew she ………………….. lying.
questions.description: When the main clause is in the past tense, the verb in the subordinate clause too will be in the past tense.

questions.question: ……………………. she worked, she could not crack the test.
questions.description: Fronted adjectives/adverbs are possible in a structure with as or though.

questions.question: The movie was ……………………..
questions.description: The present participle describes the people or things that cause the feelings. The past participle is used to say how people feel.

questions.question: Only after his death …………………….. able to appreciate him.
questions.description: Inversion is used when a sentence starts with only or hardly or seldom.

questions.question: Hardly …………………… the meeting started, when all the hell broke loose.
questions.description: Had is used before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: ‘I have deleted my social media accounts.’ ‘……………….. have I.’
questions.description: We use a structure with so to add an affirmative statement to another affirmative statement.

questions.question: As soon as it started raining, the lights …………………….. out.
If you support the idea, please ……………………. your hand.
questions.description: Raise is transitive. Rise is intransitive.

questions.question: If I had money, I ………………… lend you some.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.
